hyperdrive.not_entitled: You are not entitled to use Hyperdrive, please purchase a <0>Workers Paid Plan</0>.
hyperdrive.product.title: Hyperdrive
hyperdrive.product.description: Connect to and accelerate your existing databases.
hyperdrive.create.heading: Create Hyperdrive configuration
hyperdrive.create.subheading: Connect and accelerate an existing database using one of the methods below.
hyperdrive.create.error.generic: An error occurred while creating the configuration. Please try again later.
hyperdrive.create.private.networking_det: Configure the Zero Trust suite to connect Hyperdrive to a private database
hyperdrive.create.details.heading: Database connection details
hyperdrive.create.details.subheading: Hyperdrive stores and encrypts your connection details securely. Passwords are never returned in plain text.
hyperdrive.create.access_token.heading: Access Service Authorization Token
hyperdrive.create.access_token.subheadin: The service token will be used to verify that requests to your tunnel originate from this Hyperdrive configuration.
hyperdrive.create.access_token.not_found: No Access Token with that Client Access ID found.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.access_applicat: A policy will be added to this Access application to validate that requests made from Hyperdrive to the tunnel's hostname have the required service token.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.name.label: Configuration name
hyperdrive.create.inputs.name.sub_label: You will use this name to refer to this database configuration.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.name.descriptio: Example: staging-database-eu-west1. Configuration names cannot be changed.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.name.tooltip: Must be between 1 and 63 characters and can only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters and hypens.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.host.label: Database host
hyperdrive.create.inputs.port.label: Port
hyperdrive.create.inputs.port.tooltip: Must be a value between 0 and 65535.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.user.label: User
hyperdrive.create.inputs.password.label: Password
hyperdrive.create.inputs.database.label: Database name
hyperdrive.create.inputs.connection_stri: Must be a valid connection string.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.private_host.la: Host is part of your Cloudflare Zero Trust private network.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.tunnel.tooltip: Hyperdrive connects to this tunnel to access your private database securely.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.tunnel.no_tunne: Create a tunnel within your databases' network
hyperdrive.create.inputs.hostname.toolti: Hyperdrive uses the hostname of the tunnel to route database traffic to it.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.hostname.no_hos: Add a hostname to your tunnel.
hyperdrive.create.access_application.no_: No Access Applications for hostname '%{host}' found.
Add an Access Application to your tunnel's hostname.
hyperdrive.create.inputs.access_client_i: Must be a valid Access Client ID, eg. ae06104e437935ddfbf0ea56a17c90de.access
hyperdrive.create.inputs.access_client_s: Must be a valid Access Client Secret, eg. 13cafa2c1da593537be3a4015153645e50e5f11a1b5b92b7ffd3da3e313e4d37
hyperdrive.table.empty: Get started with Hyperdrive by creating your first configuration.
hyperdrive.metrics.heading: Summary
hyperdrive.metrics.subheading: Metrics aggregated accross this hyperdrive configuration.
hyperdrive.metrics.no_data: No data available for this time range
hyperdrive.metrics.error.generic: There was an error fetching metrics data.
hyperdrive.metrics.queries.description: Queries that have been handled by this Hyperdrive configuration by cached status.
hyperdrive.metrics.queries.title: Queries
hyperdrive.metrics.bytes.title: Result Bytes
hyperdrive.metrics.bytes.description: Total number of bytes returned by the hyperdrive config.
hyperdrive.metrics.latency.title: Latency
hyperdrive.metrics.errors.title: Errors
hyperdrive.metrics.errors.description: Number of queries that fail due to an error.
hyperdrive.settings.caching_settings.cac: Whether Hyperdrive will cache query results.
hyperdrive.settings.caching_settings.max: Max duration for which items should persist in the cache, in seconds.
hyperdrive.settings.caching_settings.sta: Number of seconds cache may serve the response after it becomes stale.
Value must be equal or greater than 0 or less than the value of max age.
hyperdrive.settings.delete_config.conten: Deleting this Hyperdrive configuration cannot be undone and may cause any Workers bound to it to no longer function as intended.
hyperdrive.delete_modal.title: Delete Configuration?
hyperdrive.delete_modal.warning: Deleting this configuration will permanently remove it and prevent it from being used in your Workers.
hyperdrive.welcome.title: Welcome to Hyperdrive
hyperdrive.welcome.description: Hyperdrive accelerates the queries you make to your existing databases by using Cloudflare's global network to speed up connections and cache your most popular queries.
hyperdrive.wrangler_tutorial.connect_to_: Connect Hyperdrive to an existing database
To connect Hyperdrive to an existing PostgreSQL database, install the Wrangler CLI and run the following command:
hyperdrive.wrangler_tutorial.bind_to_wor: To bind your Hyperdrive configuration to a Worker so that you can start querying it, copy the following binding into the wrangler.toml file of your Workers project:
hyperdrive.wrangler_tutorial.connect_fro: Connect from your favorite database driver
You can use your favorite database drivers and ORM librairies, including pg and Postgres.js, to connect to Hyperdrive just as you would use them to connect directly:
hyperdrive.resources.get_started.title: Get Started with Hyperdrive
hyperdrive.resources.get_started.descrip: Learn how to connect Hyperdrive to your database and query it from Workers.
hyperdrive.resources.connectivity_guides: Hyperdrive supports databases from a number of providers, including Neon, TimescaleDB, Supabase and Materialize.
